text: Geno Jones (born July 24, 1992https://www.iaaf.org/athletes/bahamas/geno- jones-249191 is a Bahamian sprinter from Grand Bahama who mainly competes in the 100m. He competed for the LSU Tigers track and fieldhttp://www.lsusports.net/PhotoAlbum.dbml?DB_OEM_ID=5200&PALBID;=380686 and later played American football at Holland College in Canada as a running back. His personal best of 10.42 seconds was ran in Freeport, Bahamas, at the G.B.S.S.A.A Championships, aka "Island Sports", where he won gold.http://www.baaabahamas.com/wp-content/uploads/2013/09/2010-Grand-Bahama- Island-Sports.html He won double gold in the under 17 100 m and 4x100 m relay at the 2008 Carifta Games in Saint Kitts & Nevis. He also won the under 20 boys 100 m at the 2010 Carifta Games in the Cayman Islands. He competed at the IAAF World U18 Championships and IAAF World U20 Championships without making the final in the 100 m. ==Personal bests== {| class="wikitable" ! Event !! Time !! Venue !! title: Geno Jones
